intro: Statice tineoi var. parvifolia, commonly known as dwarf statice, is a compact, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, spiky flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, making it ideal for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. Statice tineoi var. parvifolia prefers full sun and well-drained soil, and it is drought-tolerant once established.
